jointyc.jdlc

Class JdlCompiler

  • java.lang.Object
    • jointyc.jdlc.JdlCompiler

  • public class JdlCompiler
extends java.lang.Object
    Define the JointyC Definition Language Compiler. This class is used to compile the files that specify the lexicon and the grammar of a language using the JointyC Definition Language.
    Author:
    Salvatore Giampà

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JdlCompiler()
      Construct a new JDL Compiler

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      StandardCompiler compileFile(java.lang.String file, Interpreter interpreter)
      Compile a JDL text file and creates a StandardCompiler with the specified interpreter
      StandardCompiler compileResource(java.lang.String path, Interpreter interpreter)
      Compile a JDL text file included as a Java resource and creates a StandardCompiler with the specified interpreter
      StandardCompiler compileSource(java.lang.String source, Interpreter interpreter)
      Compile a JDL string and creates a StandardCompiler with the specified interpreter

    • Method Detail

      • compileSource

        public StandardCompiler compileSource(java.lang.String source,
                                      Interpreter interpreter)
                               throws UnexpectedSymbolException,
                                      SemanticException
        Compile a JDL string and creates a StandardCompiler with the specified interpreter
        Parameters:
        source - the JDL source string
        interpreter - the interpreter of the language
        Returns:
        a StandardCompiler for the language
        Throws:
        UnexpectedSymbolException - if the source string presents syntax errors
        SemanticException - if semantic errors are discovered

                                    Interpreter interpreter)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    UnexpectedSymbolException,
                                    SemanticException
        Compile a JDL text file and creates a StandardCompiler with the specified interpreter
        Parameters:
        file - the path of the JDL file
        interpreter - the interpreter of the language
        Returns:
        a StandardCompiler for the language
        Throws:
        UnexpectedSymbolException - if the source string presents syntax errors
        SemanticException - if semantic errors are discovered
        java.io.IOException

        public StandardCompiler compileStream(java.io.InputStream in,
                                      Interpreter interpreter)
                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                      UnexpectedSymbolException,
                                      SemanticException
        Compile a JDL text stream and creates a StandardCompiler with the specified interpreter
        Parameters:
        in - the stream to compile
        interpreter - the interpreter of the language
        Returns:
        a StandardCompiler for the language
        Throws:
        UnexpectedSymbolException - if the source string presents syntax errors
        SemanticException - if semantic errors are discovered
        java.io.IOException

      • compileResource

        public StandardCompiler compileResource(java.lang.String path,
                                        Interpreter interpreter)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        UnexpectedSymbolException,
                                        SemanticException
        Compile a JDL text file included as a Java resource and creates a StandardCompiler with the specified interpreter
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the resource to compile.
        Examples:
        • absolute package - "my/java/package/resource.jdl": the file "resource.jdl" is in the package "my.java.package";
        • relative package - "resource.jdl": the file "resource.jdl" is in the same package of the interpreter
        interpreter - the interpreter of the language
        Returns:
        a StandardCompiler for the language
        Throws:
        UnexpectedSymbolException - if the source string presents syntax errors
        SemanticException - if semantic errors are discovered
        java.io.IOException
